intro: Maclura humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's horse chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Hippocastanaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain bright red seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with moderate to high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and parks.
